node.title: 'We need to take a cautious approach': WA to tighten border with Queensland on Monday
node.alt: A head and shoulders shot of WA Premier Mark McGowan.
node.description: Western Australia will tighten its border controls with Queensland from Monday following community spread of the virus in the sunshine state.
node.content:
["Western Australia will\u00a0tighten\u00a0its border controls with Queensland from Monday, when visitors from that state will be required to quarantine for 14 days.", "Queensland has been elevated from a 'very low risk' to a\u00a0'low risk' jurisdiction under Western Australia's controlled border arrangements.", "The WA Government says the elevated risk level has been brought in due to the \"escalating situation\" in Queensland where there has been community spread of the virus.\u00a0", "In a statement, the Premier Mark McGowan said the heightened risk level was necessary as some cases in Queensland have an unknown source.", "\"With community spread now being experienced in Queensland and its expected move to relax border controls and quarantine arrangements with COVID-positive jurisdictions, in the midst of Omicron, we need to take caution and strengthen our\u00a0border controls with Queensland,\" he said.", "\"This will inconvenience people, however we know border controls work to keep WA safe and they're effective in managing the risks of COVID-19 entering the community,\u00a0while we don't yet have sufficient levels of vaccination coverage.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
", "Travel from Queensland will only be allowed for those who are double dose vaccinated, can present for a COVID test on arrival and on day 12, and can quarantine at a suitable location for 14 days.", "Anyone who has\u00a0arrived in WA between December 1\u00a0and 12:01am\u00a0on December\u00a013, or has been at an exposure site, is required to self-quarantine for 14 days and get tested.", "More to come.\u00a0"]
